open_without_with.title: open() used without a context manager
open_without_with.why: Opening files without a context manager can lead to resource leaks if exceptions occur before the file is closed.
open_without_with.fix: Use a `with open(...) as f:` context manager so the file is automatically closed.
open_without_with.principle: Context managers ensure deterministic resource cleanup.

eval_usage.title: Use of eval()
eval_usage.why: eval() executes arbitrary Python code, which can be dangerous if it processes untrusted input.
eval_usage.fix: Avoid eval(); use ast.literal_eval or other safe parsing if you need to parse literals, or design a proper parser/validator.
eval_usage.principle: Never execute untrusted code; prefer safe parsers and explicit logic.
